nodes.bodyText:
Could you put a comment explaining why you put the two there?
I imagine it's due to the potential lack of support for the inline-flex but in  https://caniuse.com/#feat=flexbox, it seems that all the supported browsers are ok with this.

I just do it to be extra defensive to avoid layout-breaking problems. In my experience I learned to be extra paranoid when adding flexbox fallbacks. Once we add postcss most of this can be avoided.
I can undo these changes if you prefer.

I can undo these changes if you prefer.

Now that we have the explanation, if someone dig into the code they will find this comment and understand. That's good.
Same comment as above with https://caniuse.com/#search=rem

The reason I did this for the logo is to have an extra piece of mind. Without this, in old browsers the logo would go fullscreen. That way, you wouldn't even see a faulty page, just the logo. These are the only 2 old browser fallbacks I'm adding on this PR.

nodes.bodyText: Not sure about the name. Opinions?
sounds fine to me
Doesn't really matter for private API.
This should probably just be removed altogether

Actually this was a bug, I have uncommented it. This file is the legacy styles, and I kept it to support the warnings-ng plugin until it's migrated (it depends on this file and the layout-commons.css).
I have also backported the .svg-icon to this file, for the same reason.
would be great to avoid unrelated refactorings, but not a big deal
Resolving this one. You're right but I don't want to mess things up by adding more unneeded commits

Oleg in #4463 (review):

Also keep in mind that SystemProperties API is rather designed for system properties which values are calculated once on restart. It involves calls like ServletContext checks, and I would not guarantee that it returns results immediately in all cases. Be careful when using the live switch in the frontend. If it is really needed, maybe using a private static boolean cache is preferable

This method does not address the concern expressed there.

This was done to address the concern that it was a boolean property. We understand this approach is not optimal for doing live switches. Of course, we will choose a technique that addresses these concerns once we start working on a UI-based toggle.
Resolving this one, feel free to reopen it if you think it deserves further discussion

I understand now. If it's not a blocker I'd rather follow up on this on a future PR rather than change this again, as it's a risky one. Feel free to reopen this convo again if you think it's necessary.

@fqueiruga Addressed in 205fa3a
(For which I got Felix's approval out of band)
which is it, inline-block or inline-flex?
It´s inline-flex but I left inline-block as a fallback.
I think my initial comment proposing to add a comment in the code seems even more accurate :)
Will it be part of a future work?
Yes, probably once we work on the contextual menu dropdown.
Not sure those changes are required..
Do you mean the indentation changes? The file indentation was a bit inconsistent as it had different indentation levels. I put all the lines on the same level.
🤔 I'm wondering if not having the font name on the file path would be better, so that if we choose a different font, only the font.css file is changed, not its path..
